summary: DNA vaccines were constructed to express Ebola virus GP. mice were injected with GP DNA vaccines and their splenocytes were used for hybridoma production. boosting with GP resulted in greater production of IgG-secreting hybridomas. mortality rates for children under 5 and adults over 55 were found to be 89.1% and 71.4% respectively. despite high mortality rates, there are still neither licensed anti-viral therapeutic drugs nor preventive vaccines against Ebola virus infection. DNA vaccines are thought to be better at inducing Abs that recognize native forms of protein antigens.
